content.text:
*Rainglass Veggie Wraps and Swordcarrot Dip*
Witch Hat Atelier Kitchen by Hiromi Sato, created by Kamome Shirahama

i made some veggie wraps from a recipe in a spinoff of my favorite manga series today! it's honestly been such a long time since i've made a meal based off  of a recipe.. they didn't turn out too well, i measured some ingredients wrong, and i think i just messed up a lotta stuff in general, but i still feel pretty proud of myself! turns out you can do stuff messy and make mistakes when learning how to do something youve never done before, isn't that crazy? im feeling the same way about this lil site, and a lot in general. comparing myself to people with a lot more experience won't get me too far, especially when i have so much growing to do!
im trying to decide if i should make this more of a blog postthing, or maybe a series  of sorts where i just voice some thoughts i have any time i follow a recipe from Witch Hat Kitchen. only time will tell!

content.text: i do wanna take this moment to talk about witch hat atelier though

oh my god this series makes me so happy. you can just tell theres so much passion that gets put into it in every aspect. ive never seen a series incorperate the panelling into the story as well as WHA does. you can tell the  themes of learning how to Create and constantly striving to try new things, innovate, improve, and hone your craft really come from the heart. i think the passion that shirahama puts into this story is really admirable, and there's so many moments that honestly move me to tears.
also there's like. one of the best yaoi couples ive ever  seen. orufrey my beloved. she knews what shes doing and it's not even subtle.

content.text: ok im exhausted now, i think ive been writing this for like an hour or so. i honestly havent written anything like this EVER before, it's really neat being able to blog like this, and im excited to do more! maybe i'll keep writing more about WHA in other posts. i can feel myself losing my train of thought at this point lmao. if you stumble onto this page and get down to the end here, thank's for reading this, it means a ton.
